name: Acclean Chlorhexidine Gluconate 0.12% Oral Rinse

indications.text: chlorhexidine gluconate oral rinse indicated dental visits part professional program treatment gingivitis characterized redness swelling gingivae , including gingival bleeding upon probing . chlorhexidine gluconate oral rinse tested among patients acute necrotizing ulcerative gingivitis ( anug ) . patients coexisting gingivitis periodontitis , .

contraindications.text: chlorhexidine gluconate oral rinse therapy initiated directly following dental prophylaxis . patients using chlorhexidine gluconate oral rinse reevaluated given thorough prophylaxis intervals longer six months . recommended twice daily oral rinsing 30 seconds , morning evening tooth brushing . usual 15 ml ( 1 tablespoon ) undiluted chlorhexidine gluconate oral rinse . patients instructed rinse water , mouthwashes , brush teeth , eat immediately using chlorhexidine gluconate oral rinse . chlorhexidine gluconate oral rinse intended ingestion expectorated rinsing .

warningsAndPrecautions: chlorhexidine gluconate oral rinse supplied blue liquid 4-ounce ( 118 ml ) 1-pint ( 473 ml ) amber plastic bottles child-resistant dispensing closures . store 20°c 25°c ( 68°f-77°f ) , excursions permitted 15°c 30°c ( 59°f-86°f ) [ usp controlled room temperature ] . distributed : henry schein inc. 135 duryea road melville , ny 11747 usa made usa henry schein® rx rev : 2022/04
adverseReactions: chlorhexidine gluconate oral rinse used persons known hypersensitive chlorhexidine gluconate formula ingredients .
indications_original:
Chlorhexidine gluconate oral rinse is indicated for use between dental visits as part of a professional program for the treatment of gingivitis as characterized by redness and swelling of the gingivae, including gingival bleeding upon probing. Chlorhexidine gluconate oral rinse has not been tested among patients with acute necrotizing ulcerative gingivitis (ANUG). For patients having coexisting gingivitis and periodontitis, see 
  
       
 
  
       
 
  
       
 
  PRECAUTIONS.
contraindications_original:
Chlorhexidine gluconate oral rinse therapy should be initiated directly following a dental prophylaxis. Patients using chlorhexidine gluconate oral rinse should be reevaluated and given a thorough prophylaxis at intervals no longer than six months.
                  Recommended use is twice daily oral rinsing for 30 seconds, morning and evening after tooth brushing. Usual dosage is 15 ml (1 tablespoon) of undiluted chlorhexidine gluconate oral rinse. Patients should be instructed to not rinse with water, or other mouthwashes, brush teeth, or eat immediately after using chlorhexidine gluconate oral rinse. Chlorhexidine gluconate oral rinse is not intended for ingestion and should be expectorated after rinsing.
warningsAndPrecautions_original:
Chlorhexidine gluconate oral rinse is supplied as a blue liquid in 4-ounce (118 ml) and 1-pint (473 ml) amber plastic bottles with child-resistant dispensing closures. Store at 20°C to 25°C (68°F-77°F), excursions permitted to 15°C to 30°C (59°F-86°F) [See USP controlled Room Temperature].

adverseReactions_original: Chlorhexidine gluconate oral rinse should not be used by persons who are known to be hypersensitive to chlorhexidine gluconate or other formula ingredients.
